data.name: CarryOutResearch
data.value: carry out research and development work on environmental issues

data.value: make sure you comply with the notification

data.name: ConsultThePublic
data.value: consult the public, public organisations and other organisations (for example the Health and Safety Executive) on environmental issues

data.name: CustomerSatisfaction
data.value: assess whether customers are satisfied with our service, and improve our service

data.value: Personal information charter:

data.name: Email
data.value: Email:

data.name: FootNote1
data.value: The Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) is the supervisory authority for data protection legislation. The ICO website has a full list of your rights under data protection legislation. You can access this at the following link:

data.name: FootNote2
data.value: You have the right to lodge a complaint with the ICO at any time. Should you wish to exercise that right full details are available at:

data.name: HowWeKeep
data.value: How long we keep your personal data

data.name: HowWeKeepPara
data.value: When the consent period for your notifications has expired and we have received all the required shipment recovery information for that notification, we will keep your personal data for a further 3 years in line with our standard information retention policy.

data.name: OfferYouDocuments
data.value: offer you documents or services relating to environmental matters

data.name: PassInformationToAgents
data.value: We may pass the information on to our agents or representatives to do these things for us.

data.name: PersonalDataHeading
data.value: The personal data we need

data.name: PersonalDataListItem1
data.value: A warning (e.g. informing you to increase the financial guarantee)

data.name: PersonalDataListItem2
data.value: A formal caution (e.g. informing you to stop shipping waste)

data.name: PersonalDataListItem3
data.value: A prosecution depending on the breach of condition.

data.name: PersonalDataPara1
data.value: The personal data we collect includes names, addresses and contact details (including email addresses). We are allowed to process your data because we have official authority as the environmental regulators from the Relevant Regulations. The lawful basis for processing your personal data is to perform a task in the public interest that is set out in law.

data.name: PersonalDataPara2
data.value: If you do not give us the information requested during the application process, this may halt the processing of your application. During the lifespan of the notification if you do not provide us with the information we require or we find out that some of the information is incorrect you may be in breach of your conditions of approval. This may result in

data.name: PersonalInfoHeading
data.value: How we use your personal information

data.name: PersonalInfoIntro
data.value: The Environment Agency, Scottish Environment Protection Agency (SEPA), Northern Ireland Environment Agency (NIEA) and Natural Resources Wales (known as ‘environmental regulators’) run the IWS (International Waste Shipments) Online service. The environmental regulator you submit your data to is the Controller for your personal data. A Controller determines how and why personal data (personal information) is processed. Each environmental regulator has their own policy explaining your rights and how they deal with your personal information:

data.name: PreventLawBreaking
data.value: prevent anyone from breaking environmental law, investigate cases where environmental law may have been broken, and take any action that is needed

data.name: ProcessRenewals
data.value: process renewals

data.name: ReadCarefully
data.value: Privacy notice

data.name: RequestsForInformation
data.value: respond to information requests under applicable freedom of information legislation (if the Data Protection Act allows)

data.name: ResponsibleHeading
data.value: Your responsibility

data.name: ResponsiblePara
data.value: If you have included personal data about any other individuals in your submissions, you must inform them of this. You must provide them with a copy of this privacy notice so that they are aware of how their personal data will be used.

data.name: SEPA
data.value: SEPA:

data.name: SEPAAddress
data.value: Information Governance Unit</br> Scottish Environment Protection Agency</br> Strathallan House</br> Castle Business Park</br> Stirling</br> FK9 4TZ</br>

data.name: SEPAEmail
data.value: dataprotection@sepa.org.uk

data.name: WeMayAlsoHeading
data.value: We may also process or release the information to:

data.name: WhatWeDoHeading
data.value: What we do with your personal data

data.name: WhatWeDoPara1
data.value: We use the personal data to regulate you in accordance with the Relevant Regulations.

data.name: WhatWeDoPara2
data.value: We do not use your data to make an automated decision or for automated profiling.

data.name: WhatWeDoPara3Part1
data.value: Any personal data that you provide directly to the IWS service or we input on your behalf is shared with our IT providers

data.name: WhatWeDoPara3Part2
data.value: who host and assist in the processing of the data for us through the IWS service. We may share some of your data for the purpose of analytics that assist us in the improvement and optimisation of our service. Any data that they process is under a maintenance contract. They do not use any data contained within the service for their own usage.

data.name: WhatWeDoPara4Part1
data.value: We publish some of your analysed data along with the associated business names onto the governmental open data platform (

data.name: WhatWeDoPara4Part2
data.value: ). When we receive a Freedom of Information request, the same format is applied to any data that we release. No personal data is ever released as part of these publications. No other data will be shared or disclosed to any other party outside EA without your explicit consent.

data.name: WhereWeKeep
data.value: Where your personal data is processed and stored

data.name: WhereWeKeepPara1
data.value: We store and process your personal data on servers in the UK.

data.name: WhereWeKeepPara2
data.value: As part of the application process, we may transfer your personal data outside the United Kingdom. For example, if you are exporting waste to China, then we will send your data to the Chinese Competent Authority in order to carry out the regulatory requirements and gain their consent.

data.name: WhereWeKeepPara3
data.value: By submitting your personal data, you agree to this transfer, storing or processing. We will take all steps reasonably necessary to ensure that your data is treated securely. Unfortunately, the transmission of information via the internet is not completely secure.

data.name: WhereWeKeepPara4
data.value: Although we will do our best to protect your personal data, we cannot guarantee the security of your data transmitted to our site; any transmission is at your own risk. Once we have received your information, we will use strict procedures and security features to try to prevent unauthorised access.

data.name: WhoIsCollecting
data.value: Who is collecting my data?

data.name: WhoIsCollectingPara1
data.value: The Controller is either, the Environment Agency, SEPA, NIEA or Natural Resources Wales. You can contact the relevant Data Protection Officer at:
